statement.tex: \\ %text \textbf{Partial Sums: } In the given integral\\ \[ A = \int_1^2\frac{5x^2\cdot dx}{x^2+4x+3}= 5\int_1^2\underbrace{\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3}}_Pdx \] \underline\text{how can 'P' be re-written as a partial sum}? %
\\ %text \textbf{Partial Sums - II} In \[\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3} = a + \frac{b}{x+1} + \frac{c}{x+3}\] what are the \underline\text{values of 'a', 'b' and 'c'}? %
\\ %text Given the results of Step 2, what will \[A = 5\int_1^2\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3}dx \] evaluate to? %

reason.tex:
%text If \[\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3} \neq a + \frac{b}{x+1}+\frac{c}{x+3}\] but \underline\text{instead} \frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3} = \frac{b}{x+1} + \frac{c}{x+3} then
% \begin{align} x^2 &= \left[\frac{b}{x+1}+\frac{c}{x+3} \right]\cdot\underbrace{(x+1)\cdot (x+3)}_{= x^2+4x+3} \\ &= b\cdot(x+3) + c\cdot(x+1) \\ &= \underbrace{(b+c)\cdot x + (3b + c)}_{\text{No }x^2\text{ term!}} \end{align}\\ %text Hence, \[\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3} \neq \frac{b}{x+1} + \frac{c}{x+3}\]
Instead, \[\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3} = a + \frac{b}{x+1} + \frac{c}{x+3}\] %

\begin{align} A &= 5\int_1^2\frac{x^2}{x^2+4x+3}dx \\ &= 5\int_1^2\left[ 1 + \frac{1}{2\cdot(x+1)} -\frac{9}{2\cdot(x+3)}\right]\cdot dx\\ &=5\left[\int_1^2 dx + \frac{1}{2}\int_1^2\frac{dx}{x+1}-\frac{9}{2}\int_1^2\frac{dx}{x+3} \right]\\ &= 5\left[ x + \frac{1}{2}\log(x+1) -\frac{9}{2}\log(x+3)\right]_1^2 \\ &= 5\left[ \left(2+\frac{1}{2}\log 3-\frac{9}{2}\log 5\right) - \\ &\left(1+\frac{1}{2}\log 2-\frac{9}{2}\log 4\right)\right] \\ &= 5\cdot\left[ 1 + \underbrace{\frac{1}{2}\log\frac{3}{2}-\frac{9}{2}\log\frac{5}{4}}_{\log a - \log b = \log\frac{a}{b}}\right] \end{align}
